ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: a required macro class that is very well organized with very challenging matlab problem sets
Very nice class. You will like prof moscarini a lot
I would recommend 511 to any students interested in a formal and rigorous treatment of macroeeconomics
Teaches very important tools that are broadly applicable. Also Problem Sets and coding is instructive and applicable across fields.
I would recommend it to anyone that would like to do some research on investments and unemployment.
Yes, clearly necessary for econ PhDs.
A rigorous and enlightenening introduction to modelling investment in an economy and ways of thinking about money, its purpose, policy etc

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: deepened my knowledge of macro a lot
It's going to be a part of what I do. Looking forwards to the advanced one!
I learned a lot of new mathematical tools that I could use for my future research
Deepened knowledge effectively by providing tools helpful across fields.
The course is very much focused on the state-of-the-art research on investments and unemployment.
